entry.string: Administration - XarTinyMCE
Overview
What is it?
XarTinyMCE is a platform independent web based Javascript HTML WYSIWYG editor control released as Open Source under LGPL by Moxiecode Systems AB.
It has a number of nice features over othe similar editors, and has multiple browser support, currently Mozilla, MSIE and FireFox. For futher details see

The Xaraya TinyMCE module is currenly not much more than a wrapper for TinyMCE. This module brings the beginnings of configuration options via a user interface in the Xaraya Administration area for TinyMCE, once it is installed.
How to use it?
Install this module like you would any other Xaraya module. That is:
put the tinymce folder in your Xaraya modules directory
go to the Adminpanel menu -> Modules -> View All
Click on the "install" link of the tinymce module
The XarTinyMCE editor is not turned on by default. Once the tinymce module is installed it needs to be turned on. You can now do this in the XarTinyMCE Module Configuration area or:
go to the Adminpanels menu -> Base -> Modify Config
choose the tab "Other"
on the wysiwyg editor dropdown choose "tinymce" as the default editor

In order to make modules in Xaraya use the XarTinyMCE module to display wysiwyg, you need to add the following snippet at the top of any of your page templates. eg usually this is default.xt in themes/yourtheme/pages directory. You may have more than one page template and can choose to add it to one or more. The code will affect any textareas in the template or included in that template. eg If you add it to default.xt page template it will affect all textareas in all templates that are also used in the default.xt template. If you wish to be more specific, you can just add it at the top of a specific template that contains a textarea field that you wish to convert to WYSIWYG (eg a module template like xarbb newreply.xt or newtopic.xt)

You can become more specific by choosing the Mode of "Special Labelled Only" in the configuration options. You must then also add the attribute: mce_editable="true" to any "textarea" or "div" tag that you wish to use as a WYSIWYG textarea.
xarTinyMCE WYSIWYG Dynamic Data Property

A xarTinyMCE Dynamic Data WYSIWYG textarea is also available and works with All Textareas or Special Labelled text area mode. Add a XarTinyMCE GUI Dynamic Data property to your publication type (or other module) in the usual way. No xarTinyMCE tag need be added to your template. Set row height and column width in the validation field. eg 20:80 for 20 rows high, 80 columns wide. If you can't see the xarTinyMCE GUI DD property in your DD list
Plug Ins

There are a number of plugins available to add on to xarTinyMCE. Add the plugin name to the Plug in list in the Modify Configuration settings. Some plugins require an extra button added in your Advanced Theme configuration, whereas others (like advimage and advlink) do not but require allowed element string added to appropriate configuration area. These include:

Image Browser (ibrowser) - browse your image libraries and select a file to insert to your textarea. Upload a file if you have allowed uploads in the configuration. See the configuration area for more detail
Emotions - click to add fancy emoticons
Preview and Zoom
ISpell spell checker - only available for IE
Preview and Zoom - zoom is only available in IE
Time - click to add time in configured format
Date - click to add date in configured format
Flash - allows you to add flash files

Advanced Image - allows insert of rollover images. Add the advimg to Plugins, and img[class|style|src|border=0|alt|title|hspace|vspace|width|height|align|onmouseover|onmouseout] to the Additional Tags configuration
Advanced Link - allows insert of extended link tags, plus popup windows. Add advlink to Plugins, and a[id|name|href|style|title|onclick] to Additional Tags configuration.
Included Blocks
There are no included blocks
Included Hooks
There are no included hooks
And more.. [for module developers]
